results.title: The Adventures of Handyman
results.creator_credit: Martin Murphy, Craig Salvin and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A suburban damsel in distress with a blocked sink heralds the arrival of Handyman - mild mannered and silver haired Reg O’Grady who proves that super heroes don’t have a shelf life.

results.title: The Adventure = L'Avventura
results.creator_credit: Michelangelo Antonioni, Amato Pennasilico, Cinematografiche Europee, Cinematographique Lyre and Cino Del Duca
results.brief_description: This was the film which brought Antonioni to international prominence, and was the first part of a loose trilogy which comprised ‘La Notte’ and ‘L’Eclisse’. Out of the slight story of a young woman who disappears on an island during a cruise in the Mediterranean, Antonioni conjures one of the defining texts of 1960’s ‘art cinema’ - highly formalised, deeply personal and quintessentially cinematic. Starring Monica Vitti. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: The 26 old characters
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the alphabet and writing from the earliest times. Shows some of the early writing instruments up to the development of the fountain pen.

results.title: Thatching
results.creator_credit: Angus MacAskill, E. Lawrence Couter and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: The film details a process important to house-building in England and the early New England colonies. Using authentic tools and techniques, a seasoned worker at the Plimoth Plantation in Massachusetts thatches the roof of a newly constructed cottage. The film covers all steps, which usually takes one man from eight to ten weeks to complete.

results.title: That all may learn
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: The human story of a Mexican farmer and his family, who are exploited because they cannot read or write, is used as a case to stress the need for education of all the peoples the world over. Unesco’s part in correcting these conditions is portrayed.
results.description: The human story of a Mexican farmer and his family, who are exploited because they cannot read or write, is used as a case to stress the need for education of all the peoples the world over. Unesco’s part in correcting these conditions is portrayed.

results.title: That 'Boy meets girl' thing compilation
results.creator_credit: Dennis Tupicoff and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: 4 shorts united by the theme of the unique male/female relationship dynamic. “Hot date” (dir. Kelly Wallwork): A woman out on a first date learns the hard way not to order the nachos with chillies. “Risk” (prod. Hugh Burton, dir. Christian Bernardi): Looi Prescott has asked a sexy waitress out to lunch. Does he act like his true self and consume the Creme Caramel as he is accustomed to? “Slave to love” (dir. Caroline Toomey): An elderly woman writes a hit romance novel, despite the distractions worthy of any juicy plot. “The Drive home” (dir. Annette Trevitt): While driving home a woman hears on the radio how to recognise your perfect match, provided she can make it through the tunnel and pick up radio frequency.

results.title: That's our baby: a film about prepared childbirth
results.creator_credit: Carrie Agins, Jack Agins and Lawren Productions
results.brief_description: Uses the example of the filmmaker, his wife, and their first child in order to demonstrate the techniques and principles of Lamaze training in childbirth.
